definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
a good wife and loving mother
to take a wife/to get married (man)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
man and wife fall out (idiom, from Book of Changes); marital strife

sentences.english: She leaned on my chest. I could smell the fragrance of her blouse.
sentences.chinese: 妻斜靠在我胸部上，我还闻得到她外套上芳香的味道。

sentences.english: What about going to the hospital and having a general check-up?
sentences.chinese: 妻医院去全身检查一下怎么样？

sentences.english: Jack desires her for his wife.
In 1612, Shah Jehan married Mumtaz Mahal.
sentences.chinese: 在1612年，沙贾汉娶了墨姆塔兹为妻。

sentences.english: My wife and I were together 24-7 and parenting knocked us on our asses.
sentences.chinese: 而我与妻全天候守护着，育儿使我们倦极厌尽。

sentences.english: Seeing this, Manoah and his wife fell with their faces to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 玛挪亚和他的妻看见，就俯伏于地。

sentences.english: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.
sentences.chinese: 他们像喂饱的马到处乱跑，各向他邻舍的妻发嘶声。

sentences.english: Two things doth prolong your life: a quiet heart and a loving wife.
sentences.chinese: 心情平静妻贤淑，延年益寿多得福。

sentences.english: Wife are empty, son of space, would not meet the Styx.
sentences.chinese: 妻也空，子也空，黄泉路上不相逢。

sentences.english: Lecture: Art in Photography, Taipei Fine Arts Museum, 1989.
sentences.chinese: 人观摄影个展，与友人夫妇，妻，台北市立美术馆。

sentences.english: The major health problem of the caregiver was caregiver role strain.
sentences.chinese: 另案妻主要的健康问题为照顾者角色紧张。

sentences.english: A wise man will not marry a woman who has attainments but no virtue.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的人是不会娶有才无德的女子为妻的。

sentences.english: I wake up with a start to find myself buried in my wife's empty pillow.
sentences.chinese: 一觉醒来，最先感到的是睡在妻的空枕上。

sentences.english: When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith.
sentences.chinese: 厄撒乌到四十岁时，娶了巴色玛特为妻。

sentences.english: He had seventy sons of his own, for he had many wives.
sentences.chinese: 基甸有七十个亲生的儿子，因为他有许多的妻。

sentences.english: And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
sentences.chinese: 乌利亚的妻听见丈夫乌利亚死了，就为他哀哭。

definition: concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
